title: Thermally stable inorganic Bi0.4Sb1.6Te3/metal–organic framework (MOF) composites with 1-by-1 nm pore engineering towards mid-temperature thermoelectrics
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, 17,5679-5690
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE01652A, Paper
Wanjia Zhang, Bassem A. Al-Maythalony, Fengxian Gao, Fanshi Wu, Wei Zhao, Pengfei Xu, Wenhua Zhang, Cailing Chen, Zhan Shi, Xiyang Wang, Yue Lou, Biao Xu
A uniform dispersion of MOFs within the Bi0.4Sb1.6Te3 matrix is achieved, establishing well-defined organic–inorganic interfacial bonding and realizing improved thermoelectric performance.
